inclusion.criterion: Localization-related epilepsy diagnosed by standard clinical criteria that has not responded to treatment with up to two standard antiepileptic drugs either sequentially or in combination.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients must be able to provide informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must be able to remain on their baseline AED drugs and doses for the duration of the study
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients must be able to use seizure calendars to record seizures throughout the trial.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Women of child-bearing potential and men who are unable or unwilling to take adequate contraceptive precautions, including one of the following: hormonal contraception (birth control pills, injected hormones or vaginal ring); intrauterine device; barrier methods (condom or diaphragm) combined with spermicide; surgical sterilization (hysterectomy, tubal ligation, or vasectomy in a partner
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Current treatment for another significant medical disorder, such as diabetes, or heart disease, or an untreated disorder, that is discovered during the screening examination the participant.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: An abnormality on clinical laboratory tests, physical examination, EEG or ECG that might increase the risk associated with trial participation or investigational product administration, such as hepatic enzyme elevation greater than twice normal, or hematocrit lower than 30.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: A level 4 or 5 on the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale rating for symptoms during the last month
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Concomitant treatment with more than 2 AEDs
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Evidence for a potentially progressive neurologic disorder, such as an astrocytoma
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Use of sublingual lorazepam for seizure clusters more than once per wee
exclusion.label: met

notes: Patient has a history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, and epilepsy. He has experienced seizures in the past but was able to manage them with medication. However, he recently developed facial twitching and generalized shaking, which required valium to cease seizure activity.
